today_in_history_posts.title: A Segwit2x BIP
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Sergio Demian Lerner developed a BIP for Bitcoin non-witness block space increase.
- The BIP also activates Segwit, addressing many in the Bitcoin community's requests.
- The draft and reference source are accessible on GitHub via the provided link.

today_in_history_posts.title: BOLT 11, real time micro payments, and route redundancy
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Andy Schroder inquires about missing refund address in BOLT 11, unlike BIP 70.
- He discusses adapting a fuel pump for Lightning, highlighting the need for refunds.
- Schroder explores real-time micropayments for automobiles, mentioning latency and automatic failovers.

today_in_history_posts.title: bLIP: BOLT 11 Invoice Blinded Path Tagged Field
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces a new tagged field in BOLT 11 invoices for enhanced privacy via blinded paths.
- It specifies technical details for implementation, ensuring backward compatibility with current invoice systems.
- An open call for feedback focuses on optimizing invoice structure and security.
